references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, a foundational model used in the current work for feature extraction and a key component of the comparative analysis.
This paper is seminal in establishing the theoretical underpinnings of diffusion models, which are central to the current research.
This paper is highly relevant as it proposes a prior method for diffusion-based feature extraction, which serves as a direct comparison for the new method presented in the current work.

references.paper_title: DINOv2: Learning robust visual features without supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces DINOv2, a key self-supervised learning method whose features are used in conjunction with diffusion features for performance comparison, demonstrating the broader context of the research.

references.paper_title: Masked autoencoders are scalable vision learners
references.reason: This paper is relevant because it introduces another self-supervised learning approach, Masked Autoencoders, which is considered in comparison with diffusion models for feature extraction.
